CTR.Q: What type of chart is this?

VEC.Q: How many stages are there in this funnel chart?

SRP.Q: Is the Shortlisted for Acquisition stage positioned above or below the Approved for Exhibition stage?
SRP.A: The Shortlisted for Acquisition stage is positioned {below} the Approved for Exhibition stage.

VPR.Q: What pattern does the data reduction follow in this funnel chart?
VPR.A: The data reduction follows a {logarithmic} pattern.

VE.Q: What is the value of stage Approved for Exhibition?
VE.A: The value of stage Approved for Exhibition is {38%}.

VE.Q: What is the value of stage Artworks Created?
VE.A: The value of stage Artworks Created is {100%}.

VE.Q: What is the value of stage Submitted for Review?
VE.A: The value of stage Submitted for Review is {61%}.

EVJ.Q: What is the maximum value in the funnel chart?
EVJ.A: The stage with the highest value is Artworks Created, with a value of {100%}.

EVJ.Q: What is the minimum value in the funnel chart?
EVJ.A: The stage with the lowest value is Eligible for Acquisition, with a value of {16%}.

SC.Q: What is the percentage reduction from stage Displayed in Exhibition to stage Shortlisted for Acquisition?
SC.A: The percentage reduction from stage Displayed in Exhibition to stage Shortlisted for Acquisition is {2%}.

NF.Q: In which stages of the funnel chart does the value exceed 49%? Please list the stage labels and corresponding values.
NF.A: The {Artworks Created} stage has {100%}, the {Submitted for Review} stage has {61%}.

NF.Q: In which stages of the funnel chart does the value fall below 18%? Please list the stage labels and corresponding values.
In which stages of the funnel chart does the value fall between 18% and 49%? Please list the stage labels and corresponding values.
NF.A: The {Approved for Exhibition} stage has {38%}, the {Displayed in Exhibition} stage has {22%}, the {Shortlisted for Acquisition} stage has {20%}.

NC.Q: Which reduction is greater: from stage Artworks Created to Submitted for Review, or from stage Approved for Exhibition to Displayed in Exhibition?
NC.A: The reduction from stage {Artworks Created} to {Submitted for Review} is greater.

NC.Q: Which reduction is greater: from stage Shortlisted for Acquisition to Eligible for Acquisition, or from stage Approved for Exhibition to Displayed in Exhibition?
NC.A: The reduction from stage {Approved for Exhibition} to {Displayed in Exhibition} is greater.

NC.Q: Which reduction is the greatest: from stage Shortlisted for Acquisition to Eligible for Acquisition, from stage Artworks Created to Submitted for Review, or from stage Submitted for Review to Approved for Exhibition?
NC.A: The reduction from stage {Artworks Created} to stage {Submitted for Review} is the greatest.

MSR.Q: Between which two consecutive stages in the funnel chart is the conversion rate drop the largest?
MSR.A: The largest drop in conversion rate occurs between the {Artworks Created} and {Submitted for Review} stages.

MSR.Q: Between which two consecutive stages in the funnel chart is the conversion rate drop the smallest?
MSR.A: The smallest drop in conversion rate occurs between the {Displayed in Exhibition} and {Shortlisted for Acquisition} stages.
